 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 3.2 - PREDICTABLE
CONSISTENT NAVIGATION(LEVEL AA)
On accessible websites...

Navigational mechanisms that are repeated on multiple Web pages within a set of
Web pages occur in the same relative order each time they are repeated, unless a
change is initiated by the user. 

These websites...

Make Web pages appear and operate in predictable ways.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
 A consistently located control 

A search field is the last item on every Web page in a site. Users can quickly
locate the search function. 

I still don't really understand
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/consistent-navigation.html#examples]
 Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 27 February 2020 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2020/WD-WCAG22-20200227/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)
